Description: Two joining fragments (with 1924,12-1.994) of floor of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate, slipped cream; interior: two friezes separated by band with added red band lined in white; to the centre, part of large rosette; in outer frieze, parts of two sphinxes to left; exterior: three bands to outside, two preserved to the centre. Post-firing graffito on outside.
Curator's comments: Joined to 1924,1201.993; 1924,1201.994, 1888,0601.557a-c and 1965,0930.711 are from same piece. The inscription is in a different position with respect to the external bands on the two sets of sherds, but this need not exclude their belonging together.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.745)
